mdRecord.dcterms:title: Oxford lectures on university studies, 1906-1921
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Raleigh, W. The meaning of a university.--Hendy, F. J. R. The universities and the training of teachers.--Headlam, A. C. The study of theology.--Oman, C. Inaugural lecture on the study of history.--Coupland, R. The study of the British Commonwealth.--Hutton, W. H. The teaching of Indian history.-- Wilkinson, S. The university and the study of war.--Zulueta, F. de. The study of Roman law to-day.--Wyld, H. C. English philology in English universities.--Studer, P. The study of Anglo-Norman.--Somerville, W. The place of rural economy in a university curriculum.--Jenkin, C. F. Engineering science.
Title from publisher's label on spine; each lecture as originally issued separately.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Education, Higher
Universities and colleges--Great Britain.
Universities and colleges--Curricula.
